intro: Acmella alpestris, commonly known as the alpine buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs. Acmella alpestris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
